d.title: Signout API doesnt remove cookies if the user was deleted
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

User signs in to supertokens with email provider google on a browser.
Then the user is deleted by using the deleteUser in the SDK, this is done without a browser in the middle.
User tries to signout from the browser and the signout API returns 200 but without removing the cookies like sAccessToken that is still valid and not expired. Because of that, the browser thinks the user is still signed in.

## Useful informations

**Stack**

- The Core runs inside in a docker using the image:
     imageRepository: supertokens/supertokens-postgresql
     imageRegistery: registry.supertokens.io
     imageTag: 3.14
- SDK in the backend is golang v0.7.2
- Browser uses supertokens react (but this issue also happened to me when using postman)
     supertokens-auth-react@0.24.1
     supertokens-node@11.0.1

**Steps**

1. User signs in with email provider google, cookies are created and saved in the browser.
2. Delete the user from supertokens by calling in the backend `supertokens.DeleteUser(userId)`
3. User in the browser calls signout, backend returns 200 without deleting the cookies in the response headers.

d.title: Unhandled exception error in backend when connecting core to aws RDS postgresql
Try SuperTokens in under 1 Minute Fails
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

Executing the following from your quick start instructions fails:

1. `npx create-supertokens-app@latest`
2. `cd my-app`
3. `npm run start`

I see the following:

The app launches to a blank grey screen with no UI:

![image](https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-core/assets/66364/ff849b66-6ad2-4759-abac-1103b09ad6c4)

I decided to try the non localhost url and it loads, however, any action on the UI (trying to sign up with email and password, or Google etc.) results in the 'Something went wrong' error and I've now lost faith and don't feel like exploring supertokens any more....

![image](https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-core/assets/66364/aeee986a-0dd0-4288-a214-5e9a80088744)

I don't know if your intention with the quick start is only to demo what the UI looks like without it being functional, but if that's the case, then maybe you should explain this in the quick start instructions.

If there are other dependencies and/or pre-requisites, then this should also be made clear. 

Either way, I think a quick start intro to a product or service should be seamless and error free.

## Useful informations

![image](https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-core/assets/66364/af790081-d892-4480-9ded-e0795ff97de3)
![image](https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-core/assets/66364/6031b2d0-b3c8-4e9a-ba17-084dbee6e1a7)

d.title: Users are not showing up in dashboard in multi tenant scenario
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

I have an application with multiple tentants in the same app. When users sign up with the login forms (default Supertokens PreBuiltUI) of their respective tenants they do not show up in the dashboard at api/auth/dashboard. The users show up in the database with the correct data and they can authenticate with their tenants as well. It is worth noting if I do not assign a tenant to a user they end up in 'public' by default but the users show up in the dashboard in all tenants. 


## Useful informations

The dev database is: db_d1yzrdcsd1wk

The tenants were created using:

curl --location --request PUT 'xxxxx' \
--header 'api-key:xxxxxx \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{
    "thirdPartyEnabled": true,
    "passwordlessEnabled": true,
    "emailPasswordEnabled": true
}'

d.title: sIRTFrontend = sIdRefreshToken
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

After logging into the Next.js sample, sIRTFrontend = sIdRefreshToken in my case.

Isn't this a security problem, as sIdRefreshToken is HttpOnly, while sIRTFrontend is not?

I mean if we were not supposed to read sIdRefreshToken then we can do it now, because the same value is stored in a non-HttpOnly cookie as well.


## Useful informations

Next.js example, directly after logging in.

d.title: If the DB is restarted while the core is running, in certain situations, the core is unable to connect again
d.body: The core would then have to be restarted for it to connect again. Ideally, we do not want to do that

d.title: Old tokens still work after refreshing then token
d.body:
I tested the [with-localstorage example](https://github.com/supertokens/supertokens-auth-react/tree/master/examples/with-localstorage), which uses request header `st-cookie` instead of cookie. 
I tested it with Postman, successfully signup and login, and refresh token. After refresing token, I got new accessToken, new refreshToken, new IdRefreshToken, the old tokens(including accessToken, refreshToken) still work. Is that supposed to be still valid after refreshing tokens?

d.title: context.redirectToPath is undefined after log in
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

I'm trying to redirect the user to the previous location after logging in, following this guide: https://supertokens.com/docs/thirdpartyemailpassword/common-customizations/redirecting-post-login
but after the user completes log in (with Google) the context.redirectToPath is undefined and so this flow doesn't work
i'm using react-router-dom and in case a session doesn't exist I use your api ( redirectToAuth ) to redirect the user to auth screen


## Useful informations

react-router-dom 6.3.0
react 18.2.0

i'm calling getSuperTokensRoutesForReactRouterDom under Routes (as suggested on React guide)
and if a session doesn't exist for an authenticated route i call redirectToAuth() to reroute the user to auth screen

I also can't see any route saved to local storage

d.title: Unexpected 500 error in email verify API
d.body:
Bug is that when i signout from normal mode, go to incognito and try to sign in with the same credentials, go to endpoint of email verify or try to send a code with yours default email delivery for passwordless login by phoneNumber i see exceptions on 1, 2 and 3 photo respectively 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58660439/177752935-2b957b43-ce07-4e0d-811a-ee2d7a345446.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58660439/177752991-29d322ff-7af1-41e1-9d84-394c91c476f8.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58660439/177753031-ee300885-5e8f-4b25-81a0-f46437705266.png)
I use version postgresql 13 with postgis image. When i run it locally - everything works fine, but when i send requests from dev.domain.com and another from test.domain.com to one instance of supertokens container running by registry.supertokens.io/supertokens/supertokens-postgresql image it goes throwing these eroors, maybe this information can help

d.title: Issue with running docker image on Mac M1 chip
Very high response time for setup licence key api with existing data
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

Hi folks,
I'm encountering response times of around 1 minute when calling the API to set up the license key in my self-hosted SuperTokens instance. This delay coincides with a noticeable increase in CPU usage by the database, the query consuming many resources seems to be

```sql
SELECT count(?) as c FROM ( SELECT count(user_id) as num_login_methods, app_id, primary_or_recipe_user_id FROM app_id_to_user_id WHERE primary_or_recipe_user_id IN ( SELECT user_id FROM user_last_active WHERE app_id = $1 AND last_active_time >= $2 ) GROUP BY app_id, primary_or_recipe_user_id) uc WHERE num_login_methods > ?
```

## Useful informations
I'm using this docker image: `registry.supertokens.io/supertokens/supertokens-postgresql:9.0`

I run the apps inside kubernetes, and AWS RDS aurora postgres database.
I have a paid licence, I use two different tenants connected to two different database instance. I activated roles and account linking. Every tenant has some thousand users.

My setup consists of three scaled instances of SuperTokens core, and three backend instances communicating with the core.
I use different databases per tenant, with one main tenant in one database instance and another tenant in a separate database instance.
Following guide, I configure SuperTokens core via API calls made by the backend application: at every backend startup, I do api calls to the core to inject configs (licence key, tenant configs, and so on).
The set licence call lasts minutes, while other setup api calls answer fast.

It seems a ST issue, can you have a look?

Thanks 🙏 

link to discord chat we had: https://discord.com/channels/603466164219281420/1239606145195184178
cc @rishabhpoddar, @sattvikc

d.title: Logs contains the mysql password when failing to connect to the database
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

supertokens-core logs the mysql password when failing to connect to the database.

## Useful informations

I've added to following to my `docker-compose.yml` to run supertokens-core:
```yaml
    supertokens:
        image: registry.supertokens.io/supertokens/supertokens-mysql:7.0
        container_name: supertokens
        ports:
            - '3567:3567'
        networks:
            - publishing
        environment:
            MYSQL_USER: '${MYSQL_USERNAME}'
            MYSQL_PASSWORD: '${MYSQL_PASSWORD}'
            MYSQL_HOST: '${MYSQL_HOST}'
            MYSQL_PORT: '3306'
            MYSQL_DATABASE_NAME: 'supertokens'
```

I have not yet created the `supertokens` database and expect supertokens-core to fail, which it does. However, I did not expect the logs to contain the mysql password. Below you can find the logs:

```text
± docker compose logs -f supertokens
supertokens  | Loading supertokens config.
supertokens  | Completed config.yaml loading.
supertokens  | Loading storage layer.
supertokens  | Loading MySQL config.
supertokens  | Loading supertokens version.yaml file.
supertokens  | 08 Jan 2024 14:15:04:929 +0000 | INFO | pid: 35671641-f174-425a-a463-1a192f6db15f | [main] thread | io.supertokens.storage.mysql.ConnectionPool.initPool(ConnectionPool.java:135) | Setting up MySQL connection pool.
supertokens  |
supertokens  | Setting up MySQL connection pool.
[this line] supertokens  | 08 Jan 2024 14:15:05:058 +0000 | ERROR | pid: 35671641-f174-425a-a463-1a192f6db15f | [main] thread | io.supertokens.storage.mysql.HikariLoggingAppender.doAppend(HikariLoggingAppender.java:132) | |my-db|3306|supertokens~|10|michael|>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>MY_PASSWORD<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<|allowPublicKeyRetrieval=true|mysql - Exception during pool initialization.
supertokens  |
supertokens  | Stopping SuperTokens...
supertokens  | 08 Jan 2024 14:15:05:058 +0000 | INFO | pid: 35671641-f174-425a-a463-1a192f6db15f | [main] thread | io.supertokens.Main.stopApp(Main.java:417) | Tenant(, public, public) | Stopping SuperTokens...
supertokens  |
supertokens  | Tenant(, public, public) | What caused the crash: io.supertokens.pluginInterface.exceptions.DbInitException: java.sql.SQLException: com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.HikariPool$PoolInitializationException: Failed to initialize pool: Could not connect to address=(host=my-db)(port=3306)(type=master) : (conn=1710005) Unknown database 'supertokens'
```

I've replaced the actual password with `>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>MY_PASSWORD<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<`.

d.title: Supertokens not working with node version 18.12.1
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

Supertokens web sdk version 0.8.0 is failing to run on node version 18.12.1 nextjs version 13.5.5, with a typeError

d.title: Dashboard - NextJS
Session with JWT always defaults to 1hr in-spite of adding the env variable ACCESS_TOKEN_VALIDITY
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

Session with JWT always defaults to 1hr  in-spite of adding the env variable ACCESS_TOKEN_VALIDITY=500.

## Useful Information
I was testing out the session with jwt enabled and noticed that the jwt expiry always defaults to 1hr in-spite of adding the env variable ACCESS_TOKEN_VALIDITY=60 when running super token core docker image.

Below is a example JWT with the invalid expiry date
```
{
  "sub": "a4572611-b5e6-45c7-914e-b6c8f8e0bd44",
  "https://hasura.io/jwt/claims": {
    "x-hasura-user-id": "5617",
    "x-hasura-session-id": "d48a0f3c-be0a-49eb-8d80-662432a66753"
  },
  "iss": "http://localhost:3100/api",
  "exp": 1658644557, //This is 1 hr which is not right based access token expiry time.
  "iat": 1658640927
}
```
and the Access token has the right expiry date 
```
{
  "sessionHandle": "d48a0f3c-be0a-49eb-8d80-662432a66753",
  "userId": "a4572611-b5e6-45c7-914e-b6c8f8e0bd44",
  "refreshTokenHash1": "1e779393c3de296fdcbba172c7c1bd94108c9e0e44b3ab8121705c5885891e86",
   
    "jwt": <Removed  for readability purpose>
    "_jwtPName": "jwt"
  },
  "expiryTime": 1658640986879, //This is like 1 min expiry which is correct based on the env config
  "timeCreated": 1658640928024,
  "lmrt": 1658640928014
}
```

d.title: The docker image requires root permission and is unable to run on a read only file system
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

At the moment, the user in the docker image requires root permission to run, and the docker image itself is unable to run on a read only root file system. This poses security risks that need to be dealt with.

d.title: High latencies for passwordless signup API
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

Hii, we've self hosted supertokens core and  we're experiencing high latencies for `/recipe/signinup/code` API, there was a load of approximately 100 requests per second for this api and we've seen latencies going upto 60 secs.

d.title: Migration script in changelog is wrong.
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

In the changelog the migrations script to start using version 6 fails with the error below. 

## Useful informations

(Write what happened. Add screenshots, stacktraces, videos, anything that can help)
```
ALTER TABLE dashboard_users
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS app_id VARCHAR(64) DEFAULT 'public';

ALTER TABLE dashboard_users
  DROP CONSTRAINT dashboard_users_pkey CASCADE;

ALTER TABLE dashboard_users
  ADD CONSTRAINT dashboard_users_pkey
    PRIMARY KEY (app_id, user_id);
ERROR:  relation "dashboard_users" does not exist
ERROR:  current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
ERROR:  current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
```

d.title: Module '"supertokens-auth-react/ui"' has no exported member 'getSuperTokensRoutesForReactRouterDom'
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report

With a development stack: Vitejs, React, I get this Typescript error when I import getSuperTokensRoutesForReactRouterDom

> Module '"supertokens-auth-react/ui"' has no exported member 'getSuperTokensRoutesForReactRouterDom'. Did you mean to use 'import getSuperTokensRoutesForReactRouterDom from "supertokens-auth-react/ui"' instead?

My code is available here
[Import_getSuperTokensRoutesForReactRouterDom](https://github.com/Yanis02015/import_getSuperTokensRoutesForReactRouterDom.git)

It's just a TypeScript error, so on my browser everything works perfectly. So currently I use the @ts-ignore



## Useful information

I get the same error if I use the tsc command

![Capture d’écran 2023-05-03 à 21 10 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8948640/236244129-ce3fb9ae-81b8-4a40-bbdb-e2666d94ba09.png)

![Capture d’écran 2023-05-04 à 15 49 07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8948640/236244586-ed4889a8-f5e4-4b3c-bb33-799ba2e66c2f.png)

d.title: Unhandled Runtime Error - "Error: Cancel rendering route"
d.body:
## 🐛 Bug Report
This is an intermittent error. In my site, I click on the SignIn/SignUp button:
- The ST SignIn form shows. I click on the "Sign Up" link and the Sign Up form shows fine.
- If I click on the Sign Up form again, I get this "Unhandled Runtime Error - "Error: Cancel rendering route" error.
Please check my code, and see the screen shots

My github repo (with just the files in question):
https://github.com/funk10101/nextjs-supertokens-issue

## Useful informations
- NextJS 13.0.5
- supertokens-auth-react ^0.27.3
- supertokens-node ^12.1.1

![SignInScreen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/119277851/204209994-f3fb300e-1e37-4639-a1dc-b84cc53890ee.jpg)
![SignUpScreen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/119277851/204210040-364670d9-1a18-4413-b2c1-176bb3dff025.jpg)
![SignUpScreen-Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/119277851/204210059-48c77799-99ea-4a0d-98ff-ca8a112467d8.jpg)
